intro: Cryptantha stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white or pale purple flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, adapting to its arid environment.
